item.title: Rachel add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "You gave me the key to your heart, my love, then why did you make me knock?" -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "We are shaped and fashioned by what we love " -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Hearts Live By Being Wounded" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Emily Bronte
item.description: "You know that I could as soon forget you as my existence!" -- Emily Bronte

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "What kind of living will it be when you - Oh, God! Would you like to live with your soul in the grave?" -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Rachel add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "The love that lasts the longest is the love that is never returned" -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Rachel add a quote by La Roche Foucauld
item.description: "True love is like seeing ghosts: we all talk about it, but few of us have ever seen one" -- La Roche Foucauld

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jules Feiffer
item.description: "We want playmates we can own" -- Jules Feiffer

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Rachel add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "As we all know, too much of any divine thing is destruction" -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Rachel add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "A woman unsatisfied must have luxuries. But a woman who loves a man would sleep on a board" -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Betty Friedan
item.description: "It is easier to live through someone else than to complete yourself. The freedom to lead and plan your own life is frightening if you have never faced it before. It is frightening when a woman finally realizes that there is no answer to the question 'who am I' except the voice inside herself." -- Betty Friedan

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Words are only painted fire, a look is the fire itself. She gave that look, and carried it away to the treasury of heaven, where all things that are divine belong." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rachel add a quote by H. G. Wells
item.description: "We look back through countless millions of years and see the great will to live struggling out of the intertidal slime, struggling from shape to shape and from power to power, crawling and then walking confidently upon the land, struggling generation after generation to master the air, creeping down the darkness of the deep; we see it turn upon itself in rage and hunger and reshape itself anew, we watch it draw nearer and more akin to us, expanding, elaborating itself, pursuing its relentless inconceivable purpose, until at last it reaches us and its being beats through our brains and arteries...It is possible to believe that all the past is but the beginning of a beginning, and that all that is and has been is but the twilight of the dawn. It is possible to believe that all that the human mind has accomplished is but the dream before the awakening; out of our lineage, minds will spring that will reach back to us in our littleness to know us better than we know ourselves. A day will come, one day in the unending succession of days, when beings, beings who are now latent in our thoughts and hidden in our loins, shall stand upon this earth as one stands upon a footstool, and shall laugh and reach out their hands amidst the stars." -- H. G. Wells

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Christina Rossetti
item.description: "For there is no friend like a sister In calm or stormy weather; To cheer one on the tedious way, To fetch one if one goes astray, To lift one if one totters down, To strengthen whilst one stands" -- Christina Rossetti

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jean Jacques Rosseau
item.description: "To write a good love letter, you ought to begin without knowing what you mean to say, and to finish without knowing what you have written." -- Jean Jacques Rosseau

item.title: Rachel add a quote by William Congreve
item.description: "Heav'n hath no Rage, like Love to Hatred turn'd, Nor Hell a Fury, like a Woman scorn'd." -- William Congreve

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before." -- Mae West

item.title: Rachel add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "Love seeketh not itself to please, nor for itself hath any care, but for another gives its ease, and builds a Heaven in Hell's despair." -- William Blake

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Robert Burns
item.description: "But to see her was to love her, Love but her, and love forever. Had we never lou'd sae kindly, Had we never lou'd sae blindly, Never met - or never parted - We had ne'er been broken hearted" -- Robert Burns

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Donne
item.description: "Twice or thrice had I loved thee, Before I knew thy face or name" -- Donne

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Dante Gabriel Rossetti
item.description: "Love, which is quickly kindled in the gentle heart, seized this man for the fair form that was taken from me, the manner still hurts me. Love which absolves no beloved one from loving, seized me so strongly with his charm that, as thou seest, it does not leave me yet" -- Dante Gabriel Rossetti

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Christina Rossetti
item.description: "Better by far you should forget and smile than that you should remember and be sad" -- Christina Rossetti

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by William Shakespeare
Rachel add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Alexander Woollcott
item.description: "All the things I really like to do are either immoral, illegal or fattening" -- Alexander Woollcott

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Paradise is where I am" -- Voltaire
